intro: Leptodermis velutiniflora var. velutiniflora, commonly known as the velvetleaf leptodermis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a distinctive, often fragrant odor. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in suitable habitats.
